text:
Steve Martin wanted to make cartoons, but he can barely draw stick figures. “I’m one of the few artists where the paper becomes less valuable when I draw on it,” he said. 

That’s where the illustrator Harry Bliss comes in. https://t.co/rPTLwJYwsZ

name: nytimes
text: FTI, a global consulting firm, was hired by some of the largest oil and gas companies in the world to help promote fossil fuels. The work is the latest chapter in a long history of campaigns by the oil industry to influence climate policy. https://t.co/uSwpEYz66a

name: nytimes
text: FTI helped design, staff and run campaigns and websites that sometimes obscured the industry’s role, portraying pro… https://t.co/KAqy98hjVQ

name: nytimes
text: An FTI spokesman disputed the idea that the firm worked behind the scenes for the oil and gas clients. “We hide behind no one,” he said.

name: nytimes
text: As part of its services to the oil and gas industry, FTI monitored environmental activists online, and in one insta… https://t.co/xbmAiD9kpG

name: nytimes
text: This @nytclimate article is based on interviews with a dozen former FTI employees, a review of hundreds of internal company documents and an examination of the digital trail left by the websites’ creation. https://t.co/uSwpEYhveC

name: nytimes
text: Our reporting on FTI reveals the oil industry’s efforts to influence public opinion in the face of increasing political pressure over climate change. Read the story: https://t.co/uSwpEYhveC
